metadata.title: CVE-2017-6418 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libclamav/message.c in ClamAV 0.99.2 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted e-mail message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-base - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-daemon - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-milter - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamdscan - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libclamav7 - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
